page.title: 06The Village of Stoulton
page.content: The small village of Stoulton is in a wheat growing area. It possesses an old Malthouse formerly used in ale brewing - all the local pubs made their own brew. Another interesting building is the church with its typically Norman arches and windows. Graveyard evidence shows that the richer people seemed to live much longer than the poor. Also, the winter months claimed more deaths. From 1814 there was an annual donation to Stoulton of 20 loaves of bread to the poor. The donation is now five pounds sterling given to a villager who has helped to serve the community. The old coach house used to be the village pub called the Talbot which became a girls' school called Mount Pleasant - now a private dwelling called The Mount.
